subject: Education
title: Socratic Method: Teaching by Questioning
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Socratic Method: Teaching by Questioning.

hook.text: Socrates never gave a lecture. He just asked relentless questions.

buildup.text: In ancient Athens, knowledge was drawn out, not poured in.

discovery.text: The Socratic method uses guided questions to expose contradictions in thinking.

twist.text: Socrates was executed partly because his questions embarrassed powerful people.

climax.text: Law schools still use this method todayâ€”centuries after Athens fell.

punchline.text: The oldest teaching tool is still a good question.

quiz.question: What is the core mechanism of the Socratic method?
options: Guided questions that expose contradictions in thinking
Group debates judged by an audience
